intro: Parrya michaelis, commonly known as the Michael's parrya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America, particularly in Mexico and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, triangular leaves. It produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Parrya michaelis is often found in rocky or well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
